nl.inl.blacklab.search

Class BlackLabIndexImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.search.BlackLabIndexImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, BlackLabIndex, BlackLabIndexWriter

    public class BlackLabIndexImpl
extends Object
implements BlackLabIndex, BlackLabIndexWriter

      • indexMetadataWriter

      • contentStores

        protected ContentStoresManager contentStores

      • forwardIndices

        protected Map<AnnotatedField,ForwardIndex> forwardIndices
        ForwardIndices allow us to quickly find what token occurs at a specific position. This speeds up grouping and sorting. There may be several indices on a annotated field, e.g.: word form, lemma, part of speech. Indexed by annotation.

      • searchSettings

        protected SearchSettings searchSettings

      • defaultMatchSensitivity

        protected MatchSensitivity defaultMatchSensitivity
        Should we default to case-/diacritics-sensitive searching? [default: both insensitive]

      • indexMode

        protected boolean indexMode
        If true, we want to add/delete documents. If false, we're just searching.

      • blackLabBuildTime

        public static String blackLabBuildTime()
        Return a timestamp for when BlackLab was built.
        Returns:
        build timestamp (format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss), or UNKNOWN if the timestamp could not be found for some reason (i.e. not running from a JAR, or key not found in manifest).

      • blackLabVersion

        public static String blackLabVersion()
        Return the BlackLab version.
        Returns:
        BlackLab version, or UNKNOWN if the version could not be found for some reason (i.e. not running from a JAR, or key not found in manifest).

      • registerContentStore

        protected void registerContentStore(Field field,
                                    ContentStore contentStore)
        Register a ContentStore as a content accessor. This tells the BlackLabIndex how the content of different fields may be accessed. This is used for making concordances, for example. Some fields are stored in the Lucene index, while others may be stored on the file system, a database, etc. A ContentStore is a filesystem-based way to access the contents.
        Parameters:
        field - the field for which this is the content accessor
        contentStore - the ContentStore object by which to access the content

      • forwardIndex

        public ForwardIndex forwardIndex(AnnotatedField field)
        Description copied from interface: BlackLabIndex
        Get forward index for the specified annotated field.
        Specified by:
        forwardIndex in interface BlackLabIndex
        Parameters:
        field - field to get forward index for
        Returns:
        forward index

      • annotationForwardIndex

        public AnnotationForwardIndex annotationForwardIndex(Annotation annotation)
        Description copied from interface: BlackLabIndex
        Tries to get the ForwardIndex object for the specified fieldname. Looks for an already-opened forward index first. If none is found, and if we're in "create index" mode, may create a new forward index. Otherwise, looks for an existing forward index and opens that.
        Specified by:
        annotationForwardIndex in interface BlackLabIndex
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation for which we want the forward index
        Returns:
        the ForwardIndex if found/created

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
        Description copied from interface: BlackLabIndexWriter
        Call this to roll back any changes made to the index this session. Calling close() will automatically commit any changes. If you call this method, then call close(), no changes will be committed.
        Specified by:
        rollback in interface BlackLabIndexWriter

      • delete

        public void delete(org.apache.lucene.search.Query q)
        Description copied from interface: BlackLabIndexWriter
        Deletes documents matching a query from the BlackLab index. This deletes the documents from the Lucene index, the forward indices and the content store(s).
        Specified by:
        delete in interface BlackLabIndexWriter
        Parameters:
        q - the query

      • termFrequencies

        public TermFrequencyList termFrequencies(AnnotationSensitivity annotSensitivity,
                                         org.apache.lucene.search.Query filterQuery,
                                         Set<String> terms)
        Description copied from interface: BlackLabIndex
        Determine the term frequencies for an annotation sensitivity.
        Specified by:
        termFrequencies in interface BlackLabIndex
        Parameters:
        annotSensitivity - the annation + sensitivity indexing we want the term frequency for
        filterQuery - document filter, or null for all documents
        terms - a list of terms to retrieve frequencies for, or null/empty to retrieve frequencies for all terms
        Returns:
        term frequencies

      • search

        public SearchEmpty search(AnnotatedField field,
                          boolean useCache,
                          SearchLogger searchLogger)
        Description copied from interface: BlackLabIndex
        Start building a Search.
        Specified by:
        search in interface BlackLabIndex
        Parameters:
        field - field to search
        useCache - whether to use the cache or bypass it

      • cache

        public SearchCache cache()
        Specified by:
        cache in interface BlackLabIndex

      • setCache

        public void setCache(SearchCache cache)
        Description copied from interface: BlackLabIndex
        Set the object BlackLab should use as cache. BlackLab will notify the cache of search results and will ask the cache for results before executing a search. It is up to the application to implement an effective cache, deciding whether to cache a result and ensuring the cache doesn't grow too large.
        Specified by:
        setCache in interface BlackLabIndex
        Parameters:
        cache - cache object to use

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Description copied from interface: BlackLabIndexWriter
        Is the indexer still open? It can be closed unexpectedly if e.g. the GC overhead limit is exceeded. If that happened, we should stop indexing.
        Specified by:
        isOpen in interface BlackLabIndexWriter
        Returns:
        true if the indexer was closed, false if not
